Posts.Title: Should I be tested for BRCA-1? oprygirl2 otter

Posts.Content: oprygirl2 wrote: Hello, It's been a while since I visited because my mom has finished with her treatments and has been doing good.  However, yesterday, we got some news that she has the BRCA-1 gene. I also have a family history of breast cancer on my dad's side.  His mom died from breast cancer and several of his aunts did but were never tested for BRCA, because I don't think it existed then.  So since I am at an increased risk, should I be tested?  What about my health insurance?  If they find out, I'm in trouble and better be finding a tree that grows money.  I have two small children and I would rather have my body mutilated and have a masectomy and hysterectomy than for my kids to grow up without a mom. What should I do?  HELP!!! The sun is always shining beyond the clouds Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Should I be tested for BRCA-1? oprygirl2 otter

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2008 09:15PM oprygirl2 wrote: Yay!  I don't have it.  Thanks to all of you out there for your support on this discussion board.  Keep up the good work and best of luck to all of you.
Posts.Title: Waiting for BRCA-1 test results oprygirl2 oprygirl2

Posts.Content: oprygirl2 wrote: Well, I'm relieved that I finally got tested for BRCA-1.  My mom has it.  I'm glad that I had it done but I'm a little nervous/anxious to know the results.  They told me it could be two weeks or longer depending upon my insurance.  I'm glad it isn't going to cost as much as my mom's did.  Her's was $3,200 but mine is only going to be $350.  If I don't have the gene, great, but if I do have it, I'm ready to face it.  I would rather know that I have the gene than to wonder if I do or don't and never know.  I want to do all that I can to prevent myself and my children from having to go through what my family has already been through. The sun is always shining beyond the clouds Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for BRCA-1 test results oprygirl2 oprygirl2
